snippet: Frederick Ashton’s “Cinderella,” which enters the repertory of American Ballet Theater on Monday at the Metropolitan Opera House, is the only staging of Prokofiev’s score to stand the test of time.
abstract: There have been multiple stagings of Prokofiev's 1945 ballet Cinderella but only Frederick Ashton’s 1948 version, which enters the repertory of American Ballet Theater at the Metropolitan Opera House, has stood the test of time.
lead_paragraph: Frederick Ashton’s “Cinderella,” which enters the repertory of American Ballet Theater on Monday at the Metropolitan Opera House, is the only staging of Prokofiev’s score to stand the test of time.

headline.seo: ‘Cinderella’ to Join American Ballet Theater Repertory
headline.main: Dazzling a Prince, Slowly, Gently, on Point
headline.print_headline: Dazzling a Prince, Slowly, Gently, on Point
